titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Fagen, Nelson, and Monahan family photographs V1997.075
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-02-02T15:27-0500

did.unittitle: Fagen, Nelson, and Monahan family photographs
did.abstract: Collection primarily consists of photographic portraits and snapshots of members of Fagen, Nelson, and Monahan families of Brooklyn, dating from circa 1880s to 1930s. The photographs include cabinet cards, tintypes, and various types of black-and-white prints. Of note are photographs featuring a carousel, a man in a baseball uniform, and a portrait of the singer Chauncey Olcott. It also includes one photograph and advertisements for The Aden Mountain House in Parksville, New York.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Immediate source of acquisition is unknown. Formally accessioned in 1997.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Copyright status for the photographs has not been evaluated.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Fagen, Nelson, and Monahan family photographs, V1997.075, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collection primarily consists of photographic portraits and snapshots of members of Fagen, Nelson, and Monahan families of Brooklyn, dating from circa 1880s to 1930s. The photographs include cabinet cards, tintypes, and various types of black-and-white prints. Of note are photographs featuring a carousel, a man in a baseball uniform, and a portrait of the singer Chauncey Olcott. It also includes one photograph and advertisements for The Aden Mountain House in Parksville, New York.
